name: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION
mission: SAMS works to serve the medical needs of patients in need, regardless of religious background, race, ethnicity, or political affiliation.

zakatClaimEvidence: SAMS is Zakat-eligible. You can fulfill your Zakat by donating through the Ramadan page and designating it toward: Medical treatment. Essential medications. Emergency care. Support for the most vulnerable families. (Source: https://sams-usa.net/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE claimed but no explicit zakat evidence found on website

score_details.score_summary: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: SAMS is Zakat-eligible. You can fulfill your Zakat by donating through the Ramadan page and designating it toward: Medical treatment. Essential medications. Emergency care. Support for the most vulnerable families. (Source: https://sams-usa.net/donate/)

all_citations.claim: SAMS works to serve medical needs regardless of religious background, race, ethnicity, or political affiliation.
The organization reported total revenue of $99,929,862 and a program expense ratio of 95.6%.
SAMS provides medical education and has documented reductions in PTSD symptoms after therapy.
The organization operates medical services inside Syria to address the impact of conflict on mental health.
all_citations.source_name: Human Devastation Syndrome: The Impact of Conflict on Mental Health

all_citations.claim: SAMS provides support groups for children in Jordan and Syria as part of its total medical services.
The organization offers various giving methods and is identified as Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAMS earns a strong overall score due to its high financial efficiency and direct impact on global health crises. The organization maintains a high level of transparency and a proven track record in high-urgency environments.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital sits at 4.6 months, which may require careful monitoring for long-term sustainability in volatile conflict zones.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors interested in global health and humanitarian relief, particularly within the context of Zakat-eligible giving [6]. The urgency of the cause is high, and SAMS's non-discriminatory approach ensures medical aid reaches patients regardless of religious or political affiliation [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAMS demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, maintaining a 95.6% program expense ratio and providing millions of medical services to conflict-affected populations [2][5]. Their programs have shown measurable outcomes, including reductions in PTSD symptoms and the provision of critical care within Syria [3][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Syrian American Medical Society Foundation provides life-saving medical relief and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations regardless of their background or affiliation.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.6%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised.
Strong focus on mental health, providing specialized support groups for children and PTSD therapy.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Syrian American Medical Society (SAMS) Foundation is a humanitarian organization dedicated to addressing the medical needs of patients through primary and specialty healthcare centers, emergency response, and medical education [1][3]. In the most recent fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $99,929,862 to support its extensive network of medical services inside Syria and neighboring countries [2][4].

all_citations.quote: Reduction in PTSD symptoms after therapy: Significant improvement

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid
tracks only one formal outcome metric

all_citations.quote: Areas Served: Turkey, Jordan, Syria, Gaza Strip

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAMS earns a strong overall score due to its high financial efficiency and direct impact on global health crises. The organization maintains a high level of transparency and a proven track record in high-urgency environments.

areas_for_improvement.context: While SAMS tracks high-level service counts, it currently <cite id="15">tracks only one formal outcome metric</cite> via Candid, limiting the ability to assess long-term cost-effectiveness.
The organization currently lacks a <cite id="16">documented theory of change</cite>, which is essential for articulating the explicit causal pathway of its various medical interventions.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains audited financial statements and strong board governance policies.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's massive revenue growth of <cite id="20">54.2% CAGR</cite> suggests strong donor trust and increasing capacity to absorb these risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">Working capital of 4.6 months</cite> requires careful monitoring given the high-cost nature of medical interventions in conflict zones.
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="15">lack of standardized cost-per-beneficiary data</cite>, which makes it difficult to compare their efficiency against other global health peers.

confidence.notes: Very high confidence in financial and output data; lower confidence in long-term impact outcomes.

alignment.explanation: SAMS is a strong fit for Muslim donors, as it <cite id="18">accepts Zakat</cite> for the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin) and operates primarily in <cite id="19">Muslim-majority regions</cite> facing extreme hardship.

credibility.explanation: SAMS is a highly credible institution with <cite id="1">over 25 years of operating history</cite> and a <cite id="17">100% independent board of directors</cite>. Their financial integrity is backed by <cite id="13">Candid's Platinum Seal</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, SAMS should <cite id="15">publish consistent beneficiary counts</cite> and seek third-party evaluations of their medical programs.

impact.explanation: The organization demonstrates high efficiency with a <cite id="6">95.6% program expense ratio</cite> and a direct service delivery model that minimizes intermediaries.
impact.improvement: Impact scoring could improve by <cite id="16">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> and tracking outcomes over a multi-year period to prove sustained health improvements.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Measured outcomes with limited external evaluation

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes large-scale foreign grants to medical implementers and local clinics in conflict zones.

rich_narrative.headline: The Syrian American Medical Society Foundation provides life-saving medical relief and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations regardless of their background or affiliation.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide direct, life-saving medical intervention in active conflict zones through a Zakat-eligible, highly efficient medical network.
donor_motivations: Want to support specialized medical care like PTSD therapy and surgeries
Prioritize organizations with deep local access in Syria and Gaza
Value high fundraising efficiency where nearly every dollar goes to the field
Seek to fulfill Zakat through established medical humanitarian channels
giving_considerations: Donations support a large-scale institutional response rather than individual patient sponsorships
Operations are concentrated in high-risk geopolitical environments
Rapid growth (54.2% CAGR) indicates a high capacity for new funding
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term academic research or those who require randomized controlled trial (RCT) evidence for all interventions.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while SAMS <cite id="3">tracks millions of service deliveries</cite> and some clinical outcomes, it lacks a formal theory of change or independent impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAMS operates on the logic that providing immediate medical access and training local healthcare workers in conflict zones directly reduces mortality and long-term disability.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions are not just numerous, but are effectively improving patient health outcomes and survival rates.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="20">54.2% revenue growth rate</cite> and expanding operations in Gaza and Ukraine, SAMS has significant capacity to scale its medical missions.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: 10 countries including Syria, Jordan, Lebanon, and Ukraine

peer_comparison.differentiator: SAMS is distinguished by its <cite id="7">unusually low fundraising cost of $0.01 per $1</cite>, which is significantly better than many peers in the global health sector.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Global health peer with similar revenue scale
similar_organizations.name: Helen Keller International

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="7">fundraising cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are almost entirely utilized for medical programs.
SAMS has demonstrated <cite id="9">significant improvement in PTSD symptoms</cite> among patients and supported <cite id="10">2,441 children in support groups</cite> across Jordan and Syria.
With <cite id="11">149 foreign grant recipients</cite>, SAMS effectively channels <cite id="12">$9.9 million in foreign grants</cite> to support healthcare infrastructure in high-conflict areas.

strengths_deep_dive: SAMS distinguishes itself through its deep operational integration within Syria and surrounding refugee-hosting nations. Their impact is quantified by the delivery of <cite id="4">3.2 million medical services inside Syria</cite>, a feat made possible by a network of dedicated medical professionals. The organization's commitment to transparency is reflected in its <cite id="13">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of recognition for non-profit disclosure. Furthermore, their financial resilience is evidenced by <cite id="14">4.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a buffer to maintain operations in volatile environments where funding and access can fluctuate rapidly.
rich_narrative.summary: The Syrian American Medical Society (SAMS) Foundation is a premier humanitarian organization dedicated to providing life-saving medical relief to vulnerable populations, particularly those affected by the ongoing conflict in Syria and neighboring regions. Founded in <cite id="1">1998</cite>, SAMS has grown into a massive medical network, reporting <cite id="2">$99,929,862 in total revenue</cite> in 2023. The organization operates on the frontlines of crisis relief, delivering <cite id="3">3.5 million medical services</cite> to those in need, with a staggering <cite id="4">3.2 million services provided inside Syria</cite> alone. Their work encompasses primary and specialty healthcare, emergency response, and a robust focus on <cite id="5">mental health and psychosocial support</cite>. SAMS maintains a highly efficient financial model, dedicating a <cite id="6">95.6% program expense ratio</cite> to direct service delivery while maintaining a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Beyond immediate relief, the foundation invests in <cite id="8">medical education and missions</cite> to build long-term healthcare capacity in crisis zones including Gaza, Turkey, and Ukraine.
